faq.question: Is ground-mount solar suitable for Granville's hilltown weather?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Our ground-mount systems are specifically engineered for western Massachusetts hilltown weather. faq.answer: Yes, ground-mount installations in Granville require building permits and must comply with local zoning including setback requirements. faq.answer: Complete ground-mount solar installation in Granville typically takes 8-12 weeks from initial consultation to system activation. This includes design (1-2 weeks), permitting (3-5 weeks), equipment procurement (2-3 weeks), installation (3-5 days), and final inspections (1-2 weeks).

faq.question: Can I expand my ground-mount system later?
faq.answer: Yes! Expandability is a major advantage of ground-mount solar. We design systems with future growth potential, making it easy to add panels as your energy needs increase. This flexibility is much greater than rooftop systems, ideal for growing Granville families and farms.

faq.question: What maintenance does ground-mount solar require?
faq.answer: Ground-mount systems require minimal maintenance - typically annual inspections and occasional cleaning (2-4 times yearly). The ground-level access makes maintenance much easier than rooftop systems. Most Granville customers find rain naturally cleans panels, with occasional clearing of heavy snow or leaves.
